title: Get latest price for a specific contract
description: Get latest price for a specific contract

subscribe.description: 1 - to initiate a realtime stream of prices. Note that tick trades, digit trades and less than 24 hours at-the-money contracts for the following underlying symbols are not streamed: R_100 R_50 R_25 R_75 RDBULL RDBEAR (this is because their price is constant).

amount.description: Proposed contract payout or stake value

currency.description: This can only be the account-holder's currency

date_start.description: For forward-starting contracts, epoch value of the starting time of the contract.

date_expiry.description: Epoch value of the expiry time of the contract. You must either specify date_expiry or duration.

duration_unit.description: Duration unit is s(seconds), m(minutes), h(hours), d(days), t(ticks). If this parameter is not set then duration will be counted as seconds.

barrier.description: Barrier for the contract (or last digit prediction for digit contracts). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), meaning that the entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier.

barrier2.description: Low barrier for the contract (for contracts with two barriers). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), meaning that the entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier.

trading_period_start.description: An epoch value of a predefined trading period start time

product_type.description: The product type, either basic or multi_barrier

passthrough.description: Optional field, used to pass data through the websocket, which may be retrieved via the echo_req output field.

req_id.description: Optional field to map request to response
